column3:
Indeed - that was the intention RE stored as strings - great work @laanwj 

"it works" tested ACK
Just wanted to mention that `PaymentServer::verifyAmount()` also uses `MoneyRange()`.\n
@diapolo True, but not relevant here, I'm not intending to change MoneyRange's semantics.\n
@jonasschnelli What do you think about the range issue mentioned in my comment above?\n

@laanwj: If we take a closer look at a `AmountFromValue`, than i think, `CAmount` can be `0` so `AmountFromValue()` should also be able to handle `0`ness. Even, a single function must not/should not represent the behavior of the whole system (if someone would define our system behavior to reject 0 values everywhere).\n`AmountFromValue` is also used in `createrawtransaction` and there i could imagi
Thanks. Pushed a commit that adds the checks to caller sites where needed, and adds tests.\n

I just noticed that there is a slight change of semantics here. The old check `dAmount <= 0.0 || dAmount > 21000000.0` did not allow zero amounts, whereas `MoneyRange` allows `nValue >= 0 && nValue <= MAX_MONEY`.

Unsure what to do here. The no-brainer solution would be to restore the old behavior, however 
- There is one place in the source where this is worked around with an ugly hack: https:
